name: BAMA AUTO SERVICE
text: I’ve personally been doing business with Mr. Pierce and his family for a couple years and can honestly say they are some of if not the most honest and dependable people I’ve ever done business with in my life!! The Pierce’s have gone above and beyond to make sure our business deals have not only been fair but done in way that insures the customers satisfaction above their own!!! I’ve also had the privilege of seeing what they do with their time and money personally in giving back to the community and volunteering in ministry and other activities!! I encourage everyone to do business with them and I’ll go as far as to personally guarantee you’ll be treated fair and honest!!  I own a mechanic shop and have owned multiple businesses in my lifetime. I deal with several car lots and the Pierce’s are the finest people I’ve ever done business with!!!!!

name: Montgomery Waylon
text: Brought a 2000 Camero from here on March the 1st which was a Friday. I brought the car back in on Monday the 4th and told them the service engine light came on and something under the car was rattling. I was told by the owners son that he didnt know anything about standard shift cars and they would not be responsible for anything wrong with it. Almost 3 weeks later the car starts running hot. When my husband got to me to check it out he opened up the radiator to find that it is full of J.B block seal he runs over 80 gallons of water through the radiator trying to clean it out to no avail. We replaced the thermostat that was so coroded with block seal it was rusted up. I called and left a message with Pierce auto sales telling them that the car was running hot and because someone was trying to cover up a cracked block or blown head gasket and there was so much block seal in the radiator and engine that I didn't know if the car was going to make it home and that I really needed someone to call me back because I had no way to get it home. I never recieved a call back.It cost me $60 to rent a car dolly to drag it home. Now the car came with an outside warranty but because "whoever" filled the motor up with block seal to hide a major problem until they could find an idiot "me" to take the car off of there hands the warranty will not cover the car. So now I have a blown up car sitting in my yard that I drove less then a month and repo men knocking on my door because they want there car back and still after all this time I have yet to recieve a call from anyone at Pierce Auto Sales.  I recieved more help and sympathy from the repo man in 10 minutes then I have from Pierce in 2 months. I paid $1500 down for a car that didn't even last until the first payment was due. I dont bash people or businesses but i have tried every other way to get them to talk to me. I just want my money back so I can get a car that runs and won't leave me on the side of the road less then a month after purchase.

text:
The way this establishment treated my brother and his family because he was an African American, I wouldn’t recommend this place to anyone!!! The service was awful, they kept his RV over 8 months and didn’t fix anything on the RV.

My Caucasian friends recommended this place to me because of all the things they had them fix on their RV. My brother bought his RV here to have the same small issues fixed and he was told after 8 months that they don’t fix any of those things on RV’s anymore! Unbelievable...

name: Nicholas Milner
text:
To put it as professionally and simple as I can the customer service is really bad! We weren’t reinventing the wheel nor were we solving the problems in Washington.We were simply installing a new awning and the parts never arrived over a period of six weeks.
After an extended period I called and inquired with no return call, I went by and expressed my desire to know a date to expect my repair to be completed and Brandon vowed to have me answers on the following Monday. This day come and went with no communication as well. I waited until today (Thursday) to call and there were still no answers to my question.Brandon called me 3 hours later and informed me the supplier wasn’t sure if it was shipped, going to ship or might ship!
At this time I expressed my irritation and asked Brandon if this was a job he really wanted to do or did I need to find another repair shop..His words were “ I can’t seem to satisfy you so just come get it”.. so I did and I hope whom ever reads this thinks twice before letting your unit sit and sit and sit.

name: Carol P
text: Excellent deal for $40 a month. I would give this a five star rating when the rest of the gravel is put in. Ask about their separately priced setup options, too. How wonderful it is to have someone bring your camper to where you want it, and then have it set up for you when you arrive.

text: Excellent and friendly service, and these are good honest business people.  Even though they aren't the closest RV place to me, I will always take my business to them since they are such a good business.

text: Rarely do you find exceptional customer service like you do here.  I stored my camper and 5 X 9 trailer here for a year and cannot be happier with the friendly, professional service I've received.  With a simple phone call they've gladly handled every request from packing my bearings to filling my propane tanks.  Brandon, Mark, and the rest of the team are terrific.

text: Took the trailer in for warranty work on a refrigerator that had quit working.  They were the quickest to take us in, in the area.  Great service, went the extra mile with us.  The Norcold refrigerator had a part that was new to their line and hadn't put out a bulletin for it.  The service department helped with contact with Norcold and helped set up the delivery of the part to the next area we are traveling to and also got the refrigerator working on propane.  Spent all morning with us.  No charge to us.

text: My husband and I bought a 2017 Tiffin new enjoyed it for two years, we received excellent service from the Redbay service center. When we decided to sell our Tiffany we took it to red Bay to do a few minor repairs and touch-ups. Their service center is set up , in my opinion extremely efficient. We sold our Tiffin in 2019. Stepped away went to a different brand and smaller size. Realized we wanted to go back to our 40 foot bus and we have now purchased another Tiffin. Very excited to be able to pick out exactly what details we want in our new coach. I truly hope Thor the company that recently purchased Tiffin, will continue the excellent service. Customer service was one of the reasons Tiffin was so successful. No matter who we speak to in the RV world, they know Tiffin’s reputation for quality and good service.

text:
THANK YOU SO VERY MUCH!!!!! Joe Gervias at Bankston Motorhomes of Florence, Alabama took his time to come service my RV off the clock. After 45 minutes he had it fixed like the brand new unit it is.
He was very professional and super talented at his craft. After dealing with the lacking customer service at Bankston in Huntsville, Alabama, I was hesitant to stop by the Florence location. I'm sure glad that I did.
Joe was more helpful and kind to me in the 6 hours that I knew him than the last 7 months dealing with the Huntsville location. Joe should be recognized for his loyalty to Bankston Motorhomes. It's people like Joe who makes customers want to come back. Joe went out of his way to come to my brother's house and fix an issue that had nothing to do with him other than looking out for a customer of Bankston Motorhome. THANK YOU SO MUCH MR. JOE. Bankston needs several more employees like him. 10 stars for Joe Gervais!!! Joe alone changed the way I view Bsnkston Motorhome as a complete company. HIRE MORE JOE GERVAIS !!! He is one of a kind!!

name: Bradley Mansell
text: Kevin was wonderful to deal with. Bankston of Florence is not like all the big dealerships. They treated us like they care about our business, and made sure we were familiar with our unit and satisfied with it before we took it off the lot. Thanks!

name: Harvel Scales
text:
4/17/20
My name is Harvel Scales and this message is about my visit to Bankston RV this morning at the Florence location. I've never done business with Bankston but what happened today was more than just business, it was extraordinary service!
Joe Gervais, Parts & Service Dept , had never met me until this visit. I thought I needed to buy, for the second time a new thermal couple. I was totally frustrated because I couldn't get the 6 gallon water heater working for my vintage Airstream restoration project. This was after tinkering with the thing for two days and watching about four hours of YouTube video.
With out my asking, Joe volunteered to put my 47 year old water heater on his work bench for a complete check out and test. It only took a few minutes for him to discover what I had completely overlooked; a faulty propane regulator!
Selling a thermocouple would have been the quick and simple thing to do for a customer who was interrupting the work flow for an item selling for no more than a few bucks.
At Bankston today I received a courtesy that I think is rare and over the top, all for "no charge".
You can bet that my friends in the camping world will hear this story.
Thanks Joe!
Harvel Scales

name: Regena Clark
text: Kevin was extremely knowledgeable and very helpful with the purchase of our new RV. He made the whole process so easy and enjoyable. We highly recommend Bankston of Florence to anyone looking to buy a motor home. We will definitely be back!

name: Angel Cuevas
text: This Place went above and beyong to help me and my family with our first RV purchase, Kevin went above and beyond to make this a super easy purchase. I am active duty military and Bankston RV of Florence, AL really takes care of us service members. I drove 2 1/2 hours to go see the RV and after the deal was complete Since I couldn’t bring it home the same day they had it transported to a Bankston dealer closer to me. Our salesman was Kevin and he always kept us updated on what was going on and the status of the paperwork, he is super respectful and knowledgeable and walked me and my family around the RV as many times as we wanted until we felt familiar with the use of the RV. Thank you Bankston Rv of Florence and a special Thank You to Kevin Jeffreys It was a pleasure doing business with you!

name: Last Chance
text:
A 2nd chance for this company was purely a waste. I brought my travel trailer to them for a possible trade. The sales man looked at it, then sent paperwork to the Nashville office to be appraised; new rules he said. Not sure how someone 2 hours away can properly appraise a trailer, but I went with it.

My trailer is listed on the internet in a thousand places, but because the "sales mgr" couldn't find it in his little book, he refused to give me a price for it. It's made by Forrest River, you know those folks... The biggest RV manufacturer in the world! The sales person said he would call me in a few minutes, because he would get it worked out. 24 hours later... Not a peep.

Aside from the blaring heavy metal music coming from the shop, the sales staff is clueless. This is my 2nd attempt to work with these folks. They lost my business the first time based on stock and pricing. There will not be a 3rd attempt. I didn't understand how they stayed in business, until I saw their $110 labor rate posted on the door....

text: Awful. Told Joe Gervais I was interested in looking at two different campers. Waited while he text on his phone. Told him again I would like to look at the two campers, both were locked. Asked about pamphlets for the two. He went inside and came back with a pamphlet. Never offered to open either. Didn't seem interested in selling anything or doing much. Much different experience at the Huntsville store yesterday. Mr. Bankston was extremely helpful.

name: Frank Smith
text: I made a phone call to Bankston Motor Homes on Florence Blvd last week to inquire a quote to fill my propane tank. I was told 89 cents a lbs and that I should have a 20 or 30 lbs tank on my RV. I should have known better than to choose Bankston at this time since the manager on the phone acted like it was such a hassle to give me the total price for both tanks. (After all the trouble he went through for the total.) I was told it was 19.28 for a 20lbs tank and 28.32 for a 30lbs tank. Which sounds reasonable, so I didn't bother to check anywhere else in town. When I arrived today, I was greeted by a professionally dressed man asking if I needed any help. I responded I need to get my propane tank filled and to get my brakes checked. I then pulled around to get my tank filled and was told it would be next week before they could get to my brakes. No big deal I thought. so I go inside to pay and the total came to 53 and some change. I confronted him about the quote I was gave over the phone and he immediately got defensive and started to explain why I was being charged more. Since I was interested in doing more business with them with my brake problem, you would assume that he would do what was necessary to make things right. He might have took a small loss on the propane but would have simply made it up in the outstanding labor charges. When you quote someone a price you stick with that price to make your customer feel valued. I really felt like I was nothing but in the way and a hassle to them as soon as I pulled onto the lot. Bankston Motor homes is less than a mile from my house. However I will make the drive to Coldwater RV center in Muscle shoals for any future service or maintenance I need for my RV. Last time I was there before I made my RV purchase they were very helpful and took the time that was needed to explain to me the different types of water systems I Inquired about and what would better suit my needs. I would not advise ANYONE to go with Bankston Motor Homes unless you enjoy being treated like a dog.

name: Mary Lou Bradley
text: I would be very careful when buying a car from here. We bought my daughter a BMW. He and his wife seemed honest people. He spoke of having a strong faith. Shortly after buying the car, the 1st trip on the Interstate, we started having trouble with the car. We have had the car for a year and have replaced many parts on the car & have found out recently that the car is badly flawed. We have completely lost all the money we paid for this car for my daughter. She has cried many tears knowing we have to get her a new car & we don’t have the money, right now to get her a new car. It has been just terribly nauseating and upsetting. My advice is any car you think about buying from here, have a mechanic check it out before buying. Jordan Automotive in Daphne is a great place & he is honest. He doesn’t care if the dealer gets mad. He works for his clients. Doesn’t want his customers to get screwed over like we did.

resp.text: Mary Lou, I am sorry you had a bad experience with the BMW, we had the car checked out before you bought it, and there were no issues, I wish you would have let me know when you first began to have problems. Since we don’t have a crystal ball, we always suggest an extended warranty when buying a high mileage BMW..I am sorry for your trouble with that car, that was not our intent.

name: Jep Hill
text:
Friendly salesman & decent price.

Took my vehicle in for its first oil change to find out it hadn’t been serviced adequately prior to me purchasing. I put 3k miles on the vehicle over 6 months, and found out the oil was so low (no leaks, either) the engine already needed to be flushed. The engine also makes a noise when starting, and I’ve found out the fix is $2,500+.

You may get a good price on a vehicle from Sport Center, but, in my experience, you may not get a reliable, well-maintained vehicle to last the long-haul.

name: A Google User
text: Last week I purchased my third vehicle from Sport Center Imports. When I bought my first vehicle in 2009, I was in my mid-twenties. I had been to several dealership prior to meeting Ben and Gayle Mayfield. To this day, 10 years later I remember the condescending and patronizing interaction from several of our local dealerships.  I was once naive and financially inexperienced. I was intimidated by the large dealerships and the ‘tactics’ they employed. I felt like I was being taken advantage of, looking back, I know I was. I’ve grown up now and I know what I am doing. Still, if Sport Center Imports is in business I won’t purchase from anywhere else. It might sound odd to completely trust a car salesman, but I do.  Every time I leave their lot in my new vehicle I’m amazed at the fairness and transparency with which they operate. I’ve recommended Sport Center Imports to countless family members and friends over the years. I never miss a chance to tell someone about the positive experiences I’ve had with them. They’ve earned my loyalty and if you give them a try, you’ll no doubt feel the same way I do.

name: A Google User
text: My husband and I had the WORST car-buying experience we have EVER had! We bought a 2015 Chevrolet Tahoe(with around 29,000 miles and some warranty left on it) from them that had been wrecked...twice. Even though this was on the car fax, this information was not disclosed to us. We hear a noise in the rear of the vehicle, so we took it to a local Chevrolet dealership. We were told that the vehicle had been wrecked, not fixed completely, and unsafe for my children and myself to be traveling in. We were advised to contact the dealer first and give them the opportunity to make it right. Sport Center Imports wanted us to bring them the vehicle and let them have another Chevrolet dealer take a look at it. We were given a vehicle to drive and was under the impression that they were going to do everything they could to make it "right". We sought legal advise. We were advised not to accept the vehicle after they had their mechanics look at it, but give them two options... either find us one that was comparable, or buy it back from us. About a week later, one of the owners contacted us to let us know the Tahoe was fixed...it was just a coil spring that needed to be repaired.  Once we explained that we did NOT want this Tahoe, and this was not we had paid all this money for, we were told they would find us one comparable. So once again, we were under the impression they were going to make it right. When they found us another one, it had over 36,000 miles which meant no warranty....BUT we decided to go ahead and purchase it and put it all behind us (after having it looked at by our own mechanics). They agreed to pay the first one off (as a trade-in), and turn around and finance the second one. They did. However,  a couple weeks later, we got a call from the owner letting us know that a payment was late on the first Tahoe (that we traded back in to them BEFORE the first payment was due) and that he didn't want it to damage our credit. We needed to pay it and he would pay the rest of the Tahoe off. Once again, we had to threaten to get a lawyer. We had to contact the credit union to explain what was happening and that we didn't want our credit ruined. It has been a long, drawn out mess! Instead of doing the right thing to begin with, we had to continuously fight with these people to get anything done.  Now they have this very same Tahoe listed on their website.I am warning you...if you do not want a headache, I would look elsewhere. I have since peeled their name off of my vehicle and want no part of anything to do with these people anymore!!!

resp.text: Ms Waite, I am so sorry that we could not offer you a satisfying experience.  Once I found out you were unhappy, I did all that I could do to make it right for you; took the original SUV back, gave you a free loaner car, and purchased a new Tahoe for you.  We post a free Carfax on our website on every vehicle offered for sale, for our customers convenience.  We even discounted the price of the new Tahoe to keep your payments the same, after your credit score dropped almost 80 points, which equaled a loss of $2,800 to us.   Once again, I am sorry that we were not able to exceed your expectations....

text: I usually don't write reviews but I decided that with my experience with this place that it would only be fair to give these guys their due credit. I have bought a couple of vehicles from Sports Center Imports over the last few years and I have nothing but good things to say. I tend to do my research for months prior to purchasing and have a really solid idea of pricing and what to look for in a used vehicle purchase. I watch inventory like a hawk at several dealers in a few areas to get an idea of what is available even before I ever go into buy a vehicle in case I have to play a bit of hardball. Well, I have never had to play hardball with these guys, they have never given me even the slightest issue getting vehicle I am looking for at the price range I have in mind. It's never taken me more than an hour or two to get everything taken care of and out the door. They are one of the two (the other closed down due to the owner retiring) used car dealerships that I would be okay with quite literally walking around with a blindfold on, pointing in a random direction, and buying whichever vehicle I pointed at and knowing I wouldn't have an issue.

resp.text: Vera, I am so sorry to hear, through google,  that you had issues with your truck, I wish you would have called and let us know, we may could have help steer you in the right direction.  Franchise dealership service departments do want to "FIX" anything, only "REPLACE" Everything.  I had that truck inspected at the time it was traded in, and I personally drove it to KY and back and had no issues what so ever.  I wish I had a crystal ball so I could see what the future is in regards to the vehicles we sell, but I do not.  All we can do is try and make them as front line ready to go as possible,  while maintaining the fact that it is a used a vehicle. Once again Vera, I am sorry that you had issues with your truck, and I do wish that you would have notified us sooner.

text: Great new location. It's a lot bigger than before with a very nice show room. It's much easier to pull in and out with your camper/RV. They have great customer service and a large inventory. name: Michael Roberts
text: Matt was awesome. Purchased over phone and at pickup was very helpful. Now set up with my new trailer in the florida keys

name: Nick Baldwin
text:
Quick to sale you a camper but the lifetime warranty is a joke, mostly a scam to charge you $300 each year for nothing. Lots of fine print no one mentions.  Overall poor camper experience with this place.

Customer service skills are terrible. I had to call back after I left my name and number multiple times. When someone did answer, I was given mixed information every time concerning the service on my camper.

resp.text:
Well I guess father like son using google to try to make a dealer look bad when it is the buyer who does not want to follow simple warranty guidelines and the only scam is when a person wants you to do work for free just because you made a purchase with that Company for the rest of your life = Sorry life does not work that way because everything has guidelines.

You have to change oil in your car to keep your warranty valid

You have to change your Air filter in your home to keep your  A/C under warranty

You have to go to the doctor for yearly physicals to keep your Health insurance

Why is it so hard to understand that you have to keep your Camper maintained yearly for the Life time warranty to be Valid

Mr Baldwin did not want to perform his yearly required Inspection because it was not free to him plain and simple.

RV WARRANTY FOR LIFE covers so much for as long as you own your camper and will be fixed for free today or in 20 years and all you have to do is a yearly Inspection

All of these parts would have been covered under warranty for as long as the buyer owns the Camper with no deductible
$ 0 Cost to the Owner for replacement

(Air Conditioning):Compressor, Evaporator, Condenser, Capacitors, Relays, Expansion Valve, Control module and panel Reversing Valve, Blower fan and motor and PC board

(Heating System): Furnace Igniter, Burner assembly, Gas Valves,Reversing Valve, Blower fan and motor and PC board

(Kitchen Appliances): Range/oven burner assembly, Burner valves, Convection oven, Microwave, Refrigerator/freezer, Thermocouple, Burner, Igniter and PC board, Icemaker, Built-in food processor, Built-in coffee maker, Trash compactor

(Entertainment System): Factory or dealer installed televisions – Under 40 inches, stereo receiver, compact disc player and Amplifier.

(Water Heater): Burner assembly, Tank, Thermostat, Thermocouple, Gas valve, Heating elements, Fittings and connections, Control panel    Electronic ignition assembly, Wiring harness, Relays, Switches and PC board.

(Brakes): Wheel cylinders, Calipers and Electric Brake Magnet.

(LP Gas): Gas regulators, Gas tanks, Gas valves, Tank gauges and LP lines and fittings.

(Fresh Water): Water pump, Compressor, Water tanks, Water lines, Pipes, Fittings and connections, Faucets and Traps.

(Suspension): Shackles and bushings, Leaf and coil springs and Rubber suspension springs.

(Manual Leveling Jacks):  Factory or dealer installed bolt on and welded scissor jacks.

(Interior and Exterior Hardware): Door handles, Latches and Springs.

(Waste): Shower basin, Toilets, Sinks, Holding tanks, Gate valves, Macerator pump, Connections, Pipes and Traps.

text: Good sales service from cole. Purchased what i wanted. In and out quickly

name: Pat Baldwin
text: I have bought two new campers with Ashley and have not been happy with their service afterwards.  Make sure you read all the small print before signing, or ask detail questions such as price requirements for yearly life time warranty inspections and exactly what it covers.

resp.text:
Mr Baldwin did not want to perform his yearly required Inspection because it was not free to him plain and simple.

No matter what life time warranty you have on your Car / rv / boat or powersport unit you as a Consumer will have to have the RV in this case inspected every year if you want to keep the Warranty for life active to make sure the Unit and that is with any brand make or model sold in The United states.

It is a small price to pay each year to have the factory required services done to your RV when a Air conditioner or a fridge will cost you up wards of $ 1500 to have it fixed 3,4,5,6,7, years from now and it will cost you nothing $ 0.00 under the warranty if you followed the warranty guidelines.

We are of course Sorry that Mr Baldwin feels this way but it is the Warranty Companies program not ours and to have a warranty on something that would be covered for as long as you own it and the only thing you have to do is a yearly inspection seems like a great deal if you had it for 20 years and the A/C - Fridge - hot water heater = water pump - Awning goes out and it could all be fixed at no charge

Sometimes you just cannot make every one happy I guess even if it in their best interest.

name: JANET H HARRIS
text: I recommend ASHLEY OUTDOORS columbus Ga, That staff is amazing from start to finish we were treated  5 Stars, our young salesman Justin was a enjoyment to work with.

name: Flyinhi
text:
Stay away from this place aka Columbus camper center. We purchased a brand new 2021 toy hauler in January and have had big issues with it since the first night we hooked up immediately after picking it up. I have it all documented on film and paper with the manufacturer and camping world where the rv is still at being repaired. I will share this information with anyone interested. From water leaks from furnace hoses to bubbled  up roof and water intrusion to ac not working to sparking usb charging ports on the wall. Now I understand why they never hooked it up for us to show us. My mistake for not turning on the ac when temps were in the 30s and my mistake for not climbing on the roof considering it was a brand new 2021 model. To make things worst I called service the same night, yes a little irritated, and they just hung up on me. Nevertheless I’m grateful for the lesson and this won’t happen again. And by the way my name is Ivan and bought the 2021 XLR Micro Boost, sales guy was Matt, no complaints on him unless we was aware he was a selling a defective unit and he did help us arrange for help on the interior water leak the next day after pick up during our trip.

In response to yours:
I called your sales rep immediately the next morning after leaving your facility as well as your service dept. your sales rep said you don’t do comprehensive service there and your service person hung up on me. If you just became aware of this ongoing issue that required your sales rep to coordinate a repair for us at another dealer then you clearly have no quality measures in place or else you would know. This review is more that fair and accurate and it’s on you because I didnt buy it from else where I bought it from you and you need to inspect and know what you are selling and you need to back it up instead of saying you don’t do that service or have ignorant service people hang up on a customer who drove hours to do business with you. I e gotten better service from dealers that I didn’t even buy the camper from. Even on your response below you are defensive instead try owning it then maybe you’ll grow.

resp.text:
We as a Company are very sorry for any issues with Camper and we just heard about this from the negative review posted online today which is a unfair review since we do not build the campers and we never had the chance to even fix the camper at our dealership. Everything listed on the negative review could have been fixed quickly by our Dealership but you made the choice and you took it to Camping World. Please understand the dealer does not build Campers, they buy them like any other retail store does any product sold from a supplier or factory. So if you had Purchased this camper from any dealer in America including Camping world you would have received the exact same product because they are all built the same way. So please think about your statement about our Company and how unfair it is to blame the seller and not the builder of a product when the product has a few minor defects. And the dealer never had a chance to help out with any problems with the Camper.  We wish you had brought it to us to fix because we are a lot quicker than Camping World when it comes to repairs.

In response = We have 16 service bays and 6 techs on hand everyday with over $ 100,000 in parts in our showroom it is you the Customer who did not bring the Camper in for a service issue but instead you took it to Camping World who has had it since Jan and they still have not fixed it for you so you go on the Web an trash our Company for a Product we did not build and a product you did not even give us the opportunity to fix for you ... I wish you all the best with the Camping world Repairs

name: JJ Nav
text: If their accessory prices are any indicator of their RV prices, keep looking.  I drove from Pine Mountain to here to buy a waste tote.  Their Rhino tote is $100 higher than Walmart, Gander RV, or camper world and Amazon still comes in much less. I asked Danny is this was all they could do for the price and he said yes.   Do yourself a favor and drive to Macon for the day.  Danny was a nice kid though.

resp.text: We are sorry that you felt our prices on our parts where too high but please understand, we do not buy thousands of totes like Amazon does and camping world does a year so we of course get a different cost than they do. But if you look at the Camper side of our business you will find we are always $5000 - $7000 less than Camping world or Gander mountain everyday. They use the walmart Style parts department to get buyers in the door and then they make the real money on the Campers them self by over charging on every brand they sell, Camping World has the highest prices in america because they start at retail price and not a fair price like most dealers do on Brand new Campers, so if you need to buy your parts from Camping World that is fine because they do get a better price than most dealers in the country, but please do not buy your new Camper from Camping World shop the web for your best deal and it will never ever be a Camping World store that has the best deal on a New Camper.

name: R HAWOOD
text: very happy with my purchase over weekend, ryan was very knowledgeable I will recommend him and ashley outdoors to people I bought at the box road location in columbus

name: Russell H
text: This business is only interested in selling RVs. DO NOT USE THEM FOR SERVICE!  They held mine for over 2 months, did a terrible job on warranty repairs on a brand new camper!!! I’ll take my business elsewhere!!!

resp.text: I wish people who want to leave a negative review on the web would use there full name for every one to see and not just a letter because we do not show a Russell H in our system ad we do not show a Russell H having a camper in for service unless this is another fake ad from our competition up the street playing games again = If a repair took 2 months then the parts took 2 months to get to our dealership from the factory and with covid going on right now we are lucky to even get parts because a lot of the factories who make parts are not even running up north = If we could find out and we will who and if a Mr Russell H was in our service department we would like to call him and ask him to please find another service center because he would not be welcome back at ours because our service people come to work every day and they do a very very good job on repairs = We are ranked as a Diamond with the Insurance companies for Rv claim repairs using only original parts and since we sell 38 different brands we can get any part for any trailer made = we also stock the largest instore parts inventory of any dealer in the south with more original RV parts on hand than any dealership in the south hands down so if the repair took 2 months then due to Covid your parts took 2 months to get to our store from the factory which we have no control over = But we still believe this is a fake ad

name: Tammy Kilcrease
text: We were so excited to purchase a camper back in October. The sales person was wonderful. They kept it until the next day so they could make sure everything was checked out and ready for us to take possession the next day including, supposedly, cleaning it inside and out. Well when we got it home the next day, it was definitely not cleaned. There were stains on the sink, tub and shower, ceiling, etc. Dirt and dust. Windows were not clean. I am not sure what all was included in the supposed to be cleaned but  nothing looked clean. So I spent the next day, which was a Saturday, cleaning it before I started storing items in it to go camping. We went on our first camping trip in November for a week. Had a wonderful time. We noticed the first day that the shower leaked from the sprayer. We had not used it, nor have we yet. We used bath houses at the camp site. We had to lay the sprayer in the floor of the shower so we didn't have to listen to the drip all night. The awning was missing screws where it is attached to the outside of the camper. So when we got back from our trip, my husband called to let them know about the issues. They told us to just make an appointment and we could take it up there for repair. So in December my husband called to make an appointment. They gave us January 19th to bring it so my husband loaded it up and took it to them. When he got there they said it would be 4-6 weeks before it was ready. We didn't understand since we had made an appointment as told. He said there were 4 or 5 ahead of us. He was very upset but went ahead and left it and called to talk to the guy we purchased it from. He has since talked to a so called manager and got no help. 2 weeks ago, he got a call saying they were about to start working on it and would call him back that evening when it was ready. Still haven't heard back from them yet. We are about to make the 2nd payment on it while it has been held hostage at the repair shop. We were planning a trip this month but can't because we have no camper. Buyer beware. Sucker you in by the great sales deals and no wonder it has warranty for life, you never get to use it when you have to have it worked on. So fed up.

resp.text: We have no control over warranty parts from the factory and how long it takes to get them right now and we try to finish every camper in service as soon as we get the parts when the parts arrive= Just so happens that the Camper is ready and it has been ready for over a week now waiting on the Customers to call us back= a Negative review is a unfair way to hurt your local dealer when the local dealer is at the mercy of the factory when it comes to Warranty parts shipments and the dealer has no control over warranty parts issues dealing with the factory. ( The faucet only had a drip drip issue .... )

name: KC Griffin
text: The best prices around, phenomenal service, and really awesome atmosphere. Buying process was simple and quick. Could not be happier with our decision to go through Ashley Outdoors

name: A Garrett
text: Please take the time to read the whole thing!  My husband and I bought a new StarCraft that came with the RV Warranty for Life. Due to the current pandemic and several family members with life threatening illness that we could not risk exposing to Covid, we had to prolong scheduling the warranty inspection. I spoke to Ethan the first week in Jan., who told me the first available date they had for drop off was Jan. 18th, he said it takes a couple of weeks, but a min. of 5 days. On Friday, Jan. 15th I called to confirm the drop off date & to see if we need to remove any of our personal items. The person who answered the phone said it was not necessary to remove any items as the inspection on takes 2 hrs. So my husband & I take off work and make the 3 hour trip. Upon arriving we inquire with Ethan as to how long they anticipated having the camper because the person we spoke to on Fri. gave us a completely different time frame. He said their current turn around time was 4-6 weeks!! My husband explained to him that is not what we had been told and even when we spoke to HIM he said 2 wks, but at least 5 days. (keep in mind it takes 2 hours) So my husband asked to see a manager. Blake Gardner comes out and my husband explained the situation and his response was that due to Covid they were behind and that 4-6 weeks was their turn around time. He also said that 2 days prior he had 2 service technicians test positive for Covid and they were running on a "skeleton crew". We told him that he understood that, but our frustration was the lack of communication we received about how long it would actually take and that I had just called on Friday and was told 2 hrs. He said it does only take 2 hrs once they got to it, but they had many other campers in ahead of ours and were running behind.  Blake said he understood our frustration and that they would try to get it done as soon as possible. At this point although not happy, we agreed to leave it. As we're finishing up unhooking, Blake comes back on a UTV with some man, assuming it's the one responding to these reviews as he never introduced himself. He was not friendly, never got off of the UTV and starting asking what the problem was. We explained to him the situation. He said the 4-6 week time frame was if they had to order parts, I said what parts, it's practically brand new and that is not what Blake had just told us, he said the time frame was because of Covid. So again, we're getting different story. He very rudely says, "ma'am I don't need your attitude"! In effort to keep the situation from escalading further, I do not respond and we ask Ethan if they're going to lock it up. They say no we keep it unlocked, my husband said I'm not leaving the camper unless you lock it, you have several people walking around unsupervised looking at campers, we're not leaving it unlocked. So this unnamed man, starts saying we never said we weren't going to lock it we said we don't lock the deadbolt because our key doesn't work for that. (we have one key that locks both btw). I said that is not at all what you just said. I specifically asked if you were going to lock it and you said no. So Ethan and Blake try to lock it and none of their "master keys" work. So my husband and I are having a private conversation about taking it somewhere else and again this man chimes from behind us (still on his UTV) and says "that's exactly what you need to do". Needless to say we did not leave it. Yes, we were very frustrated, as anyone else would have been after taking time off work and driving 3 hours to get the runaround about how long they needed to keep it and not only getting poor customer service, but a very rude person who just pops up AFTER Blake had already handled the situation. There was no reason for him to even come out! The best thing about the whole situation is as we're hooking back up they decide to bring keys out and lock all the existing campers that were already there. So if you have a camper there for service, I sincerely hope all of your belongings are still there.

resp.text: Like every story there are 2 sides to every story 1. we do not have guys out for covid we had 3 guys getting tested for covid because one of the guys said his mother had Covid and they where in close contact with each other at work so we had them sent home for  3 days and then they got tested to be sure and not one of them had Covid  2. Mr and Mrs Garrett was rude to our employee's from the second they arrived at our dealership which no employee should take 3 . during a Warranty for life inspection there might be a issue and we have to order parts which could take 4-6 weeks to get parts from the factory right now due to covid in the us and parts are getting hard to get. 4. We did not lock any doors on other campers while Mr and Mrs Garrett was hooking back up to their Camper because our campers are locked while on the lot because we have pass keys for all locks except dead bolts but we did ride around the lot checking for packets left in campers that had been delivered from the factory the night before ( Buyers who treat employee's like the Garretts do are not welcome at any of ours stores or any other store with good employee's working there so when they  said they where leaving to go up the road to trade the Camper in we said that would be a great idea ..........    I am glad that a Business can now give a response to fake negative google review claims because there are always 2 sides to every story

name: J And C Nellis
text: My husband and I (and our 3 boys) went during their grand opening. Super nice salespeople, awesome selection, lots of parts and accessories in their showroom. We have been to many other camper lots but this was by far the most enjoyable experience. Ronnie was a big help and showed us exactly what we were looking for. Best part about shopping there...the salesmen will greet you, give you a card, then let you shop by yourself!!!   No pushy sales person breathing down your neck as you browse, discuss, take pictures while making a decision on a large purchase.   Loved that!!

name: Jonathan Frank
text: The market for off road trailers is crowded and we spent a long time evaluating the available models. We eventually chose Vintage Trailer Work's XTR Off Road model because it represented in our view the best combination of value and quality. We have owned the XTR for 6 months now and have traveled 6500 miles over some fairly challenging terrain. Overall we are very happy with the trailer's performance and comfort level. Vintage Trailer Works stands behind its products. We were particularly impressed with the responsiveness of the owner Damon who personally attended to some minor warranty issues.

text: Great team that will treat you like family! We found a camper that we liked but it was sold. They found another just like it and had it brought to their store for us and took great care of us!

name: CJ Branton
text:
The level of customer service found at this location is rare!  I live in Nashville TN and my search for an RV took me to Bankston Motor Homes of Warrior, Alabama!  While there is a Bankston Motor Homes in Nashville I'm thankful to have met and did business with the great folks in Warrior.  I'd make that journey 1,000 times over!  Daryl, Janet, Johnny, and Paul are the most caring, thoughtful, and thorough people I have encountered in a long time, even well after the sell!  This was my very first RV purchase and Johnny spent hours with me going over every detail of my new RV.  Johnny made recommendations on proper maintenance and intervals in order to enjoy my purchase for years to come.  Johnny and Paul made sure all systems on my RV were operational and performing optimally.

Unfortunately, when I got my RV hooked up and went to pull off the lot I had some mechanical issues on my truck.  Johnny was there to help me get turned around and back on the lot.  Being late in the evening and after closing they allowed me to set up my RV on the lot and spend the night until I could get a tow truck the next morning and find a rental truck to pull my RV home.  Johnny was very helpful during the whole ordeal.  They made sure I had the necessities I needed to get through the night.  The next morning Johnny came to me and offered to take me to get breakfast if I wanted.  Daryl personally stopped what he was doing to give me a ride to pick up my rental truck.

The entire experience at Bankston Motor Homes of Warrior was top notch!  I left feeling like family.  I left the lot to go spend the weekend camping to break in my new RV.  Johnny called me Sunday evening to check on me and make sure I made it home safe and that I didn't have any issues with my RV.

I cannot say thank you enough, nor say enough good things about these folks!  Daryl, Janet, Johnny and Paul I am truly thankful for a great experience!  Y'all are the best folks!

resp.text: CJ, thanks for the great review of your experience with our Dealership.

In the future please give us a call at (205) 631-6006 which is the phone number we advertise on all of our sites and we will be glad to give you directions from anywhere, verify that we have a particular unit that you may be looking for before you drive out. name: Patsy Campbell
text:
Terrible customer service.  I tried to buy from this dealership, had my financing in order, drove two hours to the dealership.  They would not take the time to complete the paper work that day, would not let me take the unit with me, told me I was required to take a four hour class.
I understand for new owners needing to take this course.  I live in a RV full time to travel for work.  I am very familiar with the maintenance and  operation of a RV.  I even accepted they wanted to keep the RV for a few days to make sure everything worked properly.  They still would not sit down and complete the paperwork with me but wanted me to give them a down payment.
FYI then person who walks into your dealership is your CUSTOMER.  You are not doing them a favor to sell them a RV. When I asked about ordering a different RV,  which was the RV I really wanted they said oh it will take 6 weeks.  in fact they had two coming within the following two weeks.  They would not even discuss with me ordering one for me.

BUT I went to BAMA RV in Dothan Al.  They had me a unit ordered the day I called them it took a week and half to have the RV ready for me!!!!

resp.text:
Here at Paradise RV Sales in Warrior, Al. we strive to satisfy each and every customer to the best of our ability. We have set in place a very strict set of Company Policies that we follow to ensure each and every customer receives a camper that has been  thru our Service Department for a complete pre delivery inspection which consist of more than 75 items, including appliance checks, plumbing checks, electrical checks, sealant checks, proper slide out operations, installing a 12 volt battery and many more in depth inspections. This takes the better part of the day but insures that the customer can leave with confidence that everything is in working order. ( the prospective buyer  does not have the option to waive the inspection, it is required by the Manufacturer and Paradise RV Sales) We also like to walk thru the camper with the customer  after the pre delivery inspection to make sure the customer is satisfied before departing with their new camper.  ( this ensures that the customer has no surprises when they get home) As with any business we ask for earnest money to engage into a transaction and start the process, taking the camper off the market for sale, doing a pre delivery inspection and ordering Loan Contracts from a Bank. If  a prospective buyer refuses to sign an agreement to purchase with a minimum deposit for earnest money then we cannot move forward with a purchase.As a Company whose goal is Customer Satisfaction we Reserve The Right Not To Sale to any Prospective Buyer that Refuse to abide by our Company Policies.
So to all of our Customers and Non Customers Paradise RV Sales would like to take this opportunity to wish  you good luck in all of your camping adventures.

name: Joshua Willis
text: Like another reviewer, I asked if I could get my camper without the customer tutorial. Daryl and Janet did not want to sell us the camper without the customer walk through. I wanted to skip the walk through. They insisted if we were going to buy, the walk through was required. I must admit that at first I was perplexed as to why they would not just sell me a camper and take my money. They really wanted us to have a good experience with their product and had our best interest in mind when they basically refused to sell without me or my wife going through the tutorial. Now I can honestly say I'm glad that we purchased from Paradise RV. My new trailer brakes that were installed the day before failed to work. I live 2 hours away from Paradise RV but luckily Johnny, in the service department, crawled under my truck. He had the problem fixed in 15 minutes. We have had our Coachmen Clipper 17bh for 3 months now and love it.

resp.text:
I am Daryl Lowe, my wife Janet and I are the Owners here at Paradise RV Sales. We would like to take this opportunity to apologize to our real customers, it appears we are the target of Internet Spamming. In the past 30 days we have received several low ratings and slanderous remarks about our business. After a full review of our customer data base we have not been able to locate any customers named David Kerrie or Sophie Grace which David referenced in this review. If we have no records of these people evidently we have not done business with them. Therefore, the reviews are either meant for another Dealership or this could be a competitor trying to lower our Google ratings. David Kerry we would like to personally invite you to our Dealership to sit down with us, so that we may see what your concerns are. We look forward to meeting with you. We have been in business for over 20 years because we care about our customers and we want you to know we are here and available for you.
Anyone reading this review that is considering doing business with us, we ask that you take a moment to read all of our Google Reviews, check out our website www.paradiservsales.net customer testimonies page, pick up the phone and call us direct (205) 631-6006 we will more than happy to talk with you and answer any questions, if you prefer email my email address is daryl@paradiservsales.net. If you would like to come out and visit with us we will be glad to spend time with you, introduce you to our team, the Sales Dept. Jarad and Ed, the Parts Dept. Manager Barry Ugolini and our Service Manager Johnny Wideman. Janet and I are very proud of our Team and the Loyal Customer base that we have established over the past 20 years. In the Retail Business we may not be able to make everyone we come in contact with happy, but we will always be willing to sit down with anyone and try to work it out. Daryl and Janet Lowe the Proud Owners of Paradise RV Sales Warrior, Alabama.

text: The staff is super helpful and friendly but not pushy at all which is very comforting.  The prices are definitely enticing and really good from a lot of similar places. I do recommend them for you RV needs and will definitely be going back.

name: Allison Wingfield
text:
We have had many interactions with the service dept at Madison RV. Clearly, the company's focus is NOT in the service department. We had our camper there for the better part of a YEAR, only to find... (1) We could not even see the work they did or did not do until we paid in full. (2) The work they did was SHODDY. After all that time, they left a 6"x2" hole under our shower faucet. A HOLE in the shower! They didn't even do the work on the sway bar/tow area, stating, "Uh, I didn't know what to do, so I didn't do anything." But, of course we had to pay for whatever labor cost they assigned to the undone work. (3) After getting our camper back (a few months into the year they had the camper) we discovered 2 new things had broken while at their facility (kitchen pin lights and kitchen ceiling fan) and of course we were responsible for the repair.
Were they capable to do of the repairs? Yes, I really think so. But I have to conclude that they have no motivation to complete the repairs in a timely manner, no pride in their work, poor communication between customer service and the technicians... Too many complaints and too long of a story to tell.
BOTTOM LINE: I will never return to Madison RV for work to be done on our RV.

name: Brad Mason
text: Bought a new toy hauler from Clay Phillips he is a salesman and just that nothing else once you purchase from him .He sold how great thier customer service was how great the service department was .I have yet to experience anything but disappointment. Trying to get service is like pulling hens teeth. There isn't any after the sale service. All they want is the cash after that you are forgotten. They installed a washer and dryer. I think the dryer made a week or two when it broke they said just add it to the list of everything else that's wrong. Refrigerator went out this weekend no support from Clay all I got out of service was asking what kind of a refrigerator. The list goes on and on. Sad I can't even say I got what I paid for. If you a sorry salesman and service that isn't there this is your place. B Mason

name: Tanner Wilkerson
text: Upon arrival we looked around on our own and were not rushed by salespeople as you would be on a car lot.  Eventually we asked some questions and met with Frank in sales.  We were unsure of new or used and have never owned one before.  Frank spent lots of time with us and helped walk us through the decision between new and used and gave us good practical advice which led us to look at used.  They had a good selection and we found a Camper that jumped out at us and was at a good price.  At no time did we feel pushed, pressured, or rushed and we did decide to buy that day.  The reason we bought is we liked the camper we found, Frank was very generous with the deal, the entire staff were very well informed.  I have been in sales and I was absolutely impressed with Madison RVs and the people.  They have earned my business and my referrals for life.  Upon delivery the service staff spent a generous amount of time ensuring I understood how to operate everything and Frank hung out as well to make sure we were all set.  I know that if I have any questions I can call Frank who will always be willing to help.

text: Outstanding Service and Sales.  Tom Walker did an outstanding job........we had looked at the RVs they had and although they are very nice, just was not quite what we were looking for, so we told Tom what we were looking for..........about a month and a half later he texted me and said they had a used fifth wheel come in on trade that was impeccable and what he believed we were looking for.  I asked how much and it was reasonable...........but when I heard it was 10 years old I was skeptical..............Tom assured me it was in immaculate condition and said he would text pics which he did.  After seeing the pics we decided to go look at it in person, still thinking that it would not be as nice as he said...........well we were wrong it was everything thing we were looking for and more...........it looked as though it had never been used, we could not believe it.  So we said sold but what price could they do and include installing the rails for the fiver hitch.........again we were blown away with the price they gave us and told us that they always put the units in their large repair bays and go through all the diagnostics and fix everything that is wrong to include doing an orientation of the RV while in the bay and hooked up to show you exactly how everything works............a very thorough orientation.....although since we had had an rv before ours was much shorter than the four hours they allotted time for.  Again super service, friendly people, and a great salesman.  I recommend talking to Tom Walker if you are looking for an RV, he is outstanding and down to earth, could not have had a better experience!

text:
I live in Madison, Alabama, about two miles from Madison RV's business location.  I have been in Madison for 32 years and Before Madison RV was even built.  I own a motor coach and have tried several times to get parts and service from them.  They are EXTREMELY slow to "come through" and their prices for parts is EXTREMELY high compared to Bankston and online retailers of RV parts and expendables.  Example:  I just bought a filter from Bankston that cost $19.00 plus tax.  The same filter at Madison RV was marked up at $42.00... OUTRAGIOUS!!
I wanted to schedule an oil change and filter and was told I could get "on the calendar", but when I came up to the date it would be ONE TO TWO WEEKS TO GET ME IN after I was scheduled.  This has always been their story for the last 3 to 4 years every time I call and try to be a customer.  I was told about Southland International Trucks, just a few more miles down the road just off of I-565.  I went there and they scheduled me for ANY day I wanted this week!! They have a very professional shop and service bay compared to Madison RV supercenter.  I will no longer even TRY to do business with Madison RV.  Every time I called I always get a message that no one is at the counter or that they are at lunch.  I'm done.  When will they learn that customer SERVICE IS EVERYTHING!!

name: MO Grampy
text:
Absolutely the worst customer service I've ever experienced.

I bought a new Forest River toy hauler from Millican three weeks ago. Kay in the office was extremely knowledgeable and efficient, and had the paperwork done in a matter of minutes. I was disappointed that it was going to take at least a week to get it ready for me to pick up, but since this is our first new RV, thought maybe that's normal.
We scheduled to pick it up on a Saturday morning, even though that's very inconvenient according to the salesman,  planning to head off with the grand-kids on our first trip. That did not happen. It was not ready, to say the least. So much for the excitement of buying a new camper.
It was dirty, inside and out. Mildew streaks and a grimy film outside, cobwebs in the corners and dirt on the floors and countertops inside. Nobody even really tried to clean it up. Aside from being told repeatedly how inconvenient it is to do a delivery demo on a Saturday,  my biggest frustration at the time was the screen for the back ramp door.
At some point while it was sitting on the lot, the velcro adhesive had failed, so they pulled it down. That's pretty common, so I didn't think much of it when I first looked at the camper, because I assumed they'd fix that sort of thing during PDI before we picked it up. Somebody must have noticed the adhesive blobs around the doorway, because they had been peeled off to hide the mess, but the screen was wadded up and stuffed in the bottom of the closet.
We also found a damaged blind in the front window, the sewage cap was missing, the tongue jack handle was missing, and the the right speaker channel on the radio didn't work inside or out. The salesman tried to get me to go ahead and take it, promising to order parts, but I decided to leave it with them instead. Kudos again at this point to Kay, who  got involved and tried to find the parts we needed in other new campers on the lot so we wouldn't have to come back. No such luck, but I appreciate the effort. Disappointed, we left in hopes of picking it up the following week. That did not happen.
The salesman finally called me yesterday to tell me it was all fixed up and ready to go, so I took off from work early, and drove an hour back over there to pick it up. I didn't want my wife there in case there were problems, and certainly didn't want to bother the busy man on a Saturday.
When I got there, we went inside to check out the new radio, etc... and nothing worked. No 12 volt power inside the camper at all. I lost every bit of my religion for a minute, but held my temper. That's a bigger deal than you may realize. They had apparently checked everything with shore power, but not the battery. After half hour or so, the tech told me he'd replaced a main wiring connector and fuse, and everything seemed to work. Cool. Maybe this customer service nightmare is over.
I finally got my new camper home for the first time, three weeks to the day after I bought it, and decided to set it up in the yard for the wife and kids to play with, to regain some of that "new toy" excitement. That did not happen. What I got instead was two more hours of frustration and disappointment.
The remotes for the radio and outside LED light strip don't work. Another item for the long list of things somebody should have checked. A fresh battery fixed the radio remote, but the LED bar still doesn't work. All we get is the multi-color disco flashing demo mode, with no way to make it stop. I am not proud of what I had to say about that. I'll probably just put in an aftermarket strip. Or take it to Gander in Oxford.
I have no idea what they did for last three weeks, but PDI wasn't on the schedule. That stands for Pre Delivery Inspection, by the way.

You can't give a 0 star rating, so the one gold star is for Kay. She did a great job, and seemed genuinely frustrated that things were handled so badly after the sale. To the salesman, and the owner who knew the troubles we were having and did nothing, I offer nothing but utter contempt.

I do not recommend this dealer.

name: Brian Coulter
text: I started researching travel trailers back in November 2018 prepping for my first purchase. I am one people that needs all the information I can get to make best choice I can, and I can tell you that I found many problematic dealers, models, etc. along the way. I finally came across a place, Camper Inn of Huntsville (2hrs from me), in a forum discussion. So, I gave them a call expecting the same problems, however, after speaking to Frank; I could not believe that we had a real honest conversation. After the initial call, I drove down to speak with Frank face to face, even more impressed. He answered all the detailed questions about the model I was looking at and gave real honest answers. I was sold not just on the competitive pricing, but on the authenticate relationship between buyer and seller. We bought our first travel trailer in March 2019 with peace of mind my family are in good hands at Campers Inn. The service team is outstanding as well! To sum up, if you want a worry-free transaction knowing that you will be taking care of NOT taken advantage of, then please call Frank and his team.

text: Me and my Fiancé can’t say enough good things about this place! Other places assumed we were young so we couldn’t afford or be responsible enough for a newer camper. It was very disappointing to us and we almost gave it up. But we decided to give this place a try, and we are so glad we did! We were immediately greeted and helped by Jolie. We were treated with respect, and everyone was so helpful and friendly. Chris showed us everything about our fifth wheel from top to bottom, inside and out of how it all works. They were also kind enough to deliver it, as we weren’t set up to haul it completely yet. We will continue to do business here in the future! We love our fifth wheel, it’s perfect! Thank you southern rv for a wonderful experience.

name: Joe Wassell
text:
A terrible experience trying to get service on our Keystone RV. Although they claim to be a certified repair center for Keystone products, they were never able to complete the appropriate warranty information and submit it to the manufacturer. The service representative initially blamed the manufacturer for rejecting the claims, but the truth prevailed and proved otherwise.  Then the warranty representative would not approve the wording of the remaining  claims for submission to the manufacturer.
This establishment has no respect for the customer and are not honest when they answer questions from the customer. Unfortunately, we had to contact Keystone directly to closeout our work order since the service representative couldn't get it done.
I would not recommend this repair center to anyone who expects honesty, integrity & customer satisfaction.

name: Dr. Matt and Debra St. John
text: We have used Liggan RV to do work on our camper on a few different occasions. They are consistently professional, have great integrity and how they conduct business, have offered us great pricing for the work that they've done, and are very pleasant to deal with. No, their location is not the Taj Mahal, however if you are an experienced RV user you know that the Taj Mahal comes at a price.  Yesterday, we brought them our camper late and the day to fix our camper lights, however the actual problem was a completely miswired tow vehicle.  No, a 2017 Dodge is not a camper, however they spent hours troubleshooting and fixing the problem when most others would have quit or given up.  Some yahoo charge just over $400 to come out to repair the same problem, and never realized it was actually our tow vehicle, while Liggan RV fixed the entire problem for $95.   Will be bringing our camper and our future campers to this place for as long as we are rving, and my intention is for that to be the next 50 years!

name: Brittany Wiggins
text: My husband and I used them around March of this year , They told us they had fixed it after 2-3 weeks of it being there to be worked on. We even bought a $90 part and took it to them for them to put it on . Well, We get to Florida and nothing had been fix, the air didnt work more the refrigerator, the park bark and  thats not including everything else . We called them up to see why they lied and didn't fix it after the part we bought and paying the service $450 . They said the guy who worked on our rv was fired and the owner said he would fix it himself . We would even call to check to see how much longer it would be and it was always something or no one would answer , even had to drive there to talk in person . Well, 3 months of getting the run around we finally went to get it . I've never in my life had to deal with a company like this , well the owner of it now and the people that's working for him. It is very upsetting because He made it to where i believed he would do what he said and he didn't. So by time i went to the bank and tried to dispute it , it was already to late . I will never go to them again. If everyone knew more of what they are going through because of how they are doing people no one would let them work on their rv or campers . We took it there because the owner before now was really good and wouldn't do you wrong. But these people makes the company have a bad name. For the people who are happy with their work , you just got lucky that's all . But we will never use them again.

name: Wendy Uhlman
text: Great place to do business with great customer service....

name: Brian McCarver
text: I carried my camper in for hail damage in April 2017... I wouldn't let the new owner's work on a dog house...Chris told me 2 weeks at the most but didn't get it back till October... It still has things wrong with it that they replaced and broke some new things while they where working on it...The new graphics look horrible... Now Chris want answer my calls or call me back... It's ashame this was a really great business before the new owner's... Avoid Liggan RV you will regret it...

name: Patrick Horne
text:
Had an emergency LP leak while staying at the local hospital and couldn't leave.  Called in and tech said owner was coming by that way later and would stop and check it out.
Chris called me about an hour later and went through my 2 year old class A's furnace.  He finally deducted that the odor was not LP, but possibly burnoff from an unused unit.  We set the thing on heat and left it running all day with windows open and LP alarm beeping.  Sure enough it quit smelling and works perfectly.  Bought this thing used and previous owners never broke it in.
Chris refused to charge me and he spent a good :30-:45 out there.  Would give a 6th * if they had one.  Rediculous!

name: Kelly E
text:
New owners of this established business, having taken ownership beginning of 2017. I would check with them as to how old an RV they will work on.
They are careless of your belongings, RV, keys, etc. They put the things you want checked out in their computer but that is the last time they look at it, you have to go by and keep reminding them what they are supposed to be doing. In a bad neighborhood, they have multiple signs declaring "Not responsible for theft or loss". Hint. A business must do their due diligence to prevent theft and these guys do not, except for locking a fence. We simply needed some minor maintenance things done and the H2O tank & generator looked at, since we had just returned from a 3 day trip. The RV was driven on the trip without problems, and to the establishment. I went by there to check on it almost 3 weeks later because we had not heard from anyone in 10 days. RV wasn't running. Kept it over 5 weeks total & got it home - not running.
Chris and Chad separately but both immediately jump to conclusion it must be a bad alternator as the reason it is not running.  Chad owns an alternator shop. Hmmm.
We needed new covers & caulking done on roof. They slopped on some clear thin liquid over rotted caulk. See pictures of this. Waited on covers that had to be ordered, so Chad said. Then they had to wait on propane valve, - I found for $25 +/- online or about $65 for replacement tank & valve combo locally which is what I will be doing, and the covers $15-20 each online. They have no parts supplier, obviously. I had my son go on top to check things out as soon as we got home. Then I went up there because I thought he was mistaken. Omg. Busted covers and a new cover that had only 2 screws holding it down instead of 6! Found the other 4 stuck in the clear liquid that was slopped down the middle. Also a cigarette butt stuck in it as well.  When confronted Chris claimed he fired the guy that did it (Idk) and said he didn't know they were to replace all the covers (Idk).The inside was a mess and there was no reason, the entire RV needs cleaning!! I will never patronize the business again. We will still have to get the things on the list fixed, and prob have to repair things this placed "fixed".  If I had a do over I would check for licensing for the different aspects of RV repair. Repairs done ON premises. Will update on settled charges. If anyone would like further info I will be glad to answer questions to the best of my knowledge at kellymc1109@ gmail . com.

name: karen naramore
text: If I could give ZERO STARS I would.  We took our camper in JANUARY.  All it needed was siding replaced on one side from some slight hail damage.  We didn’t expect it to be repaired in a month - but THREE months later he had not  even ordered all the supplies!  Every time we called for the status, we got one excuse after another.   The reason we took it in January is because we figured it would take 2 or 3 months.  But when we called the other day (April 4), he said he needed to order some more siding and had no idea how long it would take!!  That was the final straw!  Maybe if he had ordered ALL the siding within a few weeks of us bringing it in JANUARY, he could have had the supplies within a month or two and we could have had our camper back by April (a VERY reasonable amount of time!). At the rate he was going, we wouldn’t have had our camper back for another 3 months!!  So needless to say, we went and picked our camper up and have somebody that can have it fixed in a few weeks.   And this person is ordering the supplies and we won’t even have to bring our camper until they have the supplies there and we can have it back 2 weeks later.  Wish we would have used them to begin with!!  Not only was Shafer’s awful, the owner was extremely rude and unprofessional.  He never apologized, but just rudely offered excuse after excuse!!   I honestly don’t know how he keeps any business.  Especially when there are plenty of other places people can use.

name: Julia Dane
text:
We just bought a 2005 Kodiak Skamper from Joe. It was a overall pleasant experience and after some haggling I feel that we got a fair price.

I had found the listing through Facebook market place and drove up to Mobile to look at it. The listing stated that the only problem with the camper was that the awning needed to be replaced... easy enough fix. Before waking though the camper I did ask again if there was anything that may need to be repaired or replaced. I was assured that everything (lights, water, sewage, A/C) was in proper working order. While going through the camper and doing a full inspection I did note a few things else that needed to be fixed like an outer seal on one of the pop outs and then when the camper was hooked it up to our truck, the back right blinker was not working. When these problems were brought to their attention, it was clear that they knew about them. They were not forthcoming with the issues until I found them.

The outer seal is an easy fix, the inner seal was completely intact, and there was no water damage noted. I also plan on replacing the lights with LEDS so neither of those were dealbreakers for me. I do wish that I had been informed about it before I did my own inspection.

All in all, I would recommend going there for a fair deal, just be certain to check everything to make sure nothing was overlooked.

Joe himself is younger and very kind. Him and his uncle are willing to work a good price for you. They do most of the work themselves and are quite knowledgeable on all things RV. It does seem to be a family run business and so we worked with his uncle and aunt while Joe was busy.
